org.obapanel.jedis.semaphore

Class JedisAdvancedSemaphore

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obapanel.jedis.semaphore.JedisAdvancedSemaphore
  • Deprecated.

    @Deprecated
public class JedisAdvancedSemaphore
extends java.lang.Object
    This semaphore works, but it is deprecated because its usage is very tricky The acquire method waits por a pub/sub message if permits not obtained. But waiting for a message forces the code to do some strange decisions This is because - We must use a JedisPubSub to listen to the message on the channel - The JedisPubSub subscribe action must be placed into a new background thread that will be blocked (waiting for events and executing the code) until unsubscribe - Also the JedisPubSub must use other jedis connection than the one used to check the semaphore. As the release method publish messages, an error will arise if the same connection is used to publish and subscribe So for a semaphore with messages we must use two connection and a new background thread; and manage them. For this cause, I prefer the JedisSemaphore implementation with polling. But this is here for anyone to use or refactor
